Appendicitis.text:
Coverage should extend to
E. coli
,
Klebsiella
,
Proteus
, and
Bacteroides
(an anaerobe)

Adult_Simple_Appendicitis.text:
Antibiotic prophylaxis should be coordinated with surgical consult
Options:
Cefoxitin
2g IV q6 hours OR
Cefotetan
2g IV q12 hours OR
Moxifloxacin
400mg IV once daily OR
Ertapenem
1g IV once daily

Pediatric_Simple_Appendicitis.text:
Options:
Cefoxitin
40mg/kg IV q6 hours
Cefotetan
40mg/kg IV q12 hours
Gentamicin
2.5mg/kg IV q8hrs +
Metronidazole
7.5mg/kg IV 16hrs OR
Clindamycin
10mg/kg IV q8hrs

Complicated_Appendicitis.text:
Defined as perforation, abscess, or phlegmon
Options:
Metronidazole
500 mg IV q8hrs +
Cefepime
50 mg/kg IV q12hrs OR
Ciprofloxacin
400 mg IV q12hrs OR
Levofloxacin
750 mg IV q24hrs OR
Aztreonam
30 mg/kg IV q8hrs
Imipenem/Cilastatin
25 mg/kg IV q6hrs (max 500mg)
Meropenem
20 mg/kg IV q8hrs (max 1g)
Piperacillin/Tazobactam
100 mg/kg (max 4.5g) IV q8hrs
Cautious use should be applied to use of
fluoroquinolones
in complicated pediatric appendicitis due to the risk of tendon injury

Cholecystitis.text:
Most often isolated organisms are
Escherichia coli
,
Klebsiella pneumonia
, and
anaerobes
, especially
Bacteroides fragilis

Uncomplicated.text:
Pathogenicity of
Enterococci
remains unclear and specific coverage is not routinely suggested for community-acquired infections
[1]
Ertapenem
1g IV once daily OR
Metronidazole
500mg IV q8hrs PLUS
Ciprofloxacin
400mg IV q12 hrs OR
Levofloxacin
750mg IV q24hrs OR
Ceftriaxone
1g IV q24hrs

Complicated_or_Healthcare_Associated.text:
Examples of complication include severe
sepsis
or hemodynamic instability
Vancomycin
15-20mg/kg PLUS any of the following options
Options:
Metronidazole
500mg IV q8hrs PLUS
Ciprofloxacin
400mg IV q12hrs
Piperacillin/Tazobactam
4.5g IV q8hrs
Imipenem/Cilastin
500mg IV q6hrs
Doripenem
500mg IV q8hrs
Meropenem
1g IV q8hrs

Mild/Moderate_Infection.text:
Vancomycin
125 mg PO four times daily for 10 days
Fidaxomicin
200 mg PO two times daily for 10 days
Metronidazole
500mg PO or IV three times daily for 10 days (third line therapy)

Serious_Infection.text:
Vancomycin
125 mg PO four times daily for 10 days
Fidaxomicin
200 mg PO two times daily for 10 days

Mild/Moderate_Infection.text:
Vancomycin
125 mg PO four times daily for 10 days
Fidaxomicin
200 mg PO two times daily for 10 days
Metronidazole
500mg PO or IV three times daily for 10 days (third line therapy)

Serious_Infection.text:
Vancomycin
125 mg PO four times daily for 10 days
Fidaxomicin
200 mg PO two times daily for 10 days

Vancomycin
125 mg PO four times daily for 10 days
Fidaxomicin
200 mg PO two times daily for 10 days

Uncomplicated_2.text:
Options:
Metronidazole
500mg PO Q8hrs AND
Ciprofloxacin
500mg PO BID x5days
Amoxicillin/Clavulanate
875/125 PO Q8hrs x5days (or
Augmentin
XR 2 tablets BID [each tablet 1gm
amoxicillin
62.5mg clavulanate])
[2]
[3]
Trimethoprim/Sulfamethoxazole
, one double-strength tablet bid, and
Metronidazole
500 mg Q8h
Moxifloxacin
400mg PO QDaily
[4]

Complicated.text:
Options:
Ticarcillin/Clavulanate
3.1 g IV Q6h or
Piperacillin/Tazobactam
3.375 g IV q6 hours x 7-10 days
Ciprofloxacin
400 mg IV q12h and metronidazole 1 g IV Q12h
Ampicillin
2 g IV Q6h and
Metronidazole
500 mg IV q6h
Plus
(
Gentamicin
7 mg/kg Q24h or
Ciprofloxacin
400 mg IV Q12h)
Imipenem
500 mg IV Q6h

Uncomplicated_2.text:
Options:
Metronidazole
500mg PO Q8hrs AND
Ciprofloxacin
500mg PO BID x5days
Amoxicillin/Clavulanate
875/125 PO Q8hrs x5days (or
Augmentin
XR 2 tablets BID [each tablet 1gm
amoxicillin
62.5mg clavulanate])
[2]
[3]
Trimethoprim/Sulfamethoxazole
, one double-strength tablet bid, and
Metronidazole
500 mg Q8h
Moxifloxacin
400mg PO QDaily
[4]

3.1 g IV Q6h or

3.375 g IV q6 hours x 7-10 days

tables.Santa Monica-UCLA: Metronidazole500mg IV q8h+Vancomycin15mg/kg/dose IV q12h (Max dose = 1500mg)Plus one of the following:Piperacillin/tazobactam4.5g IV q6hErtapenem1g IV q24hCeftriaxone1g IV q24h
tables.Other: One of the following:Piperacillin-tazobactamTicarcillin-clavulanate3.1 g IV every 6 hoursErtapenem1 g every 24 hoursMoxifloxacin400 mg IV every 24 hours

tables.Santa Monica-UCLA: aztreonam2g IV q8h+metronidazole500mg IV q8h+/-vancomycin15mg/kg/dose IV q12h (Max dose = 1500mg)

tables.Santa Monica-UCLA: aztreonam2g IV q8h+metronidazole500mg IV q8h+/-vancomycin15mg/kg/dose IV q12h (Max dose = 1500mg)

Campylobacter_jejuni.text:
Erythromycin
500mg PO BID x 5 days
Ciprofloxacin
500mg PO BID x 5 days OR
Azithromycin
500mg PO once daily x 5 days

Entamoeba_Histolytica.text:
Metronidazole
750mg PO three times daily for 5-10 days PLUS
Paromomycin
500mg q8hrs for 7 days OR
Iodoquinol
650mg q 8hrs daily  20 days

Giardia_lamblia.text:
Metronidazole
250mg PO q8hrs for 7-10days
Tinidazole
2g PO once

Microsporidium.text:
Albendazole
400mg PO BID x 21 days + HAART therapy if
HIV
positive

Cryptosporidium.text:
Paromomycin
500mg PO q8hrs x 14-28days +HAART therapy if
HIV
positive

Salmonella_(non_typhoid).text:
Treatment is not recommended routinely but should be considered if:
Immunocompromised
Age<6 mo or >50yo
Has any prostheses
Valvular heart disease
Severe Atherosclerosis
Active Malignancy
Uremic
Options:
Immunocompromised patients should have 14 days of therapy
TMP/SMX
1 DS tab PO BID x 5 days
Ceftriaxone
2g IV once daily x 5 days
Levofloxacin
500mg PO once daily x 5 days
Ciprofloxacin
500mg PO BID x 5 days

Shigella.text:
Treatment extended for 10 days if immunocompromised'
Ciprofloxacin
500mg PO BID x 5 days
TMP/SMX
1 DS tab PO BID x 5 days
Levofloxacin
500mg PO once daily x 5 days
Azithromycin
500mg PO daily x 5 days

Vibrio_Cholerae.text:
Doxycycline
300mg PO as single dose
TMP/SMX
1 tablet (5mg/kg) PO BID daily x 3 daily
Azithromycin
20mg/kg (1g) PO once

Yersinia_enterocolitica.text:
Antibiotics are not required unless patient is immunocompromised or systemically ill
Ciprofloxacin
500mg PO BID daily
Levofloxacin
500mg PO once daily
TMP/SMX
1 DS tab (5mg/kg) PO BID

Empiric_Therapy_(IP).text:
10- to 14-day course of intraperitoneal (IP) antibiotics that are administered by the patient on an outpatient basis or IV antibiotics and intraperitoneal for admitted patients
Vancomycin
30mg/kg loading followed by 0.6 mg/kg IP daily  PLUS
[5]
Ceftazidime
1g IP daily OR
Gentamycin
0.6mg/kg daily
Catheter removal/exchange is usually only done if IP antibiotics fail (fungal, pseudomonal), and should be done in consultation with a nephrologist
[6]

Empiric_Tharapy_(IV).text:
Although IP antibiotics are preferred IV antibiotics can be considered with coordination with nephrology for dosing. Coverage should be the same as IP antibiotics
[7]
[8]

Traveler's_Diarrhea.text:
Options for Adults:
Ciprofloxacin
750mg PO once daily x 1-3 days
[9]
First choice for use except in South and Southeast Asia
[10]
Azithromycin
500mg PO q24h x 3 days OR 1000mg PO x 1
[11]
Nausea is a frequent adverse event
[12]
First choice for use in South and Southeast Asia
[13]
Rifaximin
200mg PO TID x 3 days
[14]
Ineffective against mucosally invasive pathogens (
Shigella
,
Salmonella
,
Campylobacter
)
Considered very safe as it is not absorbed

Oral_therapy_with_Quinolone_Susceptibili.text:
Ciprofloxacin
500-750 mg PO q 12 hrs x 14 days

Parenteral_Therapy_with_Quinolone_Suscep.text:
Ciprofloxacin
400 mg IV q 12 hrs x 10 days

Parenteral_Therapy_with_Quinolone_Resist.text:
if nalidixic acid resistant, assume
fluoroquinolone
resistant
Ceftriaxone
2mg IV q 24 hrs x 14 days
OR
Cefixime
10-15 mg/kg IV q 12 hrs x 8 days

Oral_Therapy_with_Quinolone_Resistance.text:
Azithromycin
1 g PO daily x 5 days
